meanings.definition: Refuse to acknowledge as belonging or pertaining to oneself; deny the ownership of.
meanings.sent1: She disowns all responsibility for the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: He disowns his actions when he knows he is wrong.
meanings.sent3: The cat disowns the knocked-over plant as if it was someone else's doing.
meanings.sent4: The storm disowns the calm before it, bringing chaos and destruction.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disowns any knowledge of the missing homework, surprising the students.

meanings.definition: To refuse to acknowledge or accept as one's own; repudiate.
meanings.sent1: The company disowns any involvement in the scandal.
meanings.sent2: She disowns the rumors spread about her by standing up for herself.
meanings.sent3: The child disowns the messy room, blaming it on the playful dog.
meanings.sent4: The darkness disowns the light, enveloping everything in shadows.
meanings.sent5: The politician disowns his previous statements, causing confusion among voters.
